executive_summary: Over the five years to 2024, industry revenue has slumped due to falling industry demand and adverse effects largely contributable to the pandemic. Amid the pandemic, the industry was disrupted by reduced enrollment, school closures, and stay-at-home measures. Enrollment fell throughout 2020 due to a combination of overall economic uncertainty and uncertainty regarding the massage schools industry, resulting in a decline in industry revenue in 2020.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Massage Schools Provide Various Programs and Techniques
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Operators in the Massage Schools industry provide instruction on massage therapy and issue massage therapy licenses. These schools offer a variety of programs depending on the level of training desired. Specifically, education can range from a basic certification or a diploma in massage therapy to a bachelor's degree in massage therapy. Currently, the most common type of program offered is a basic certification, as it requires fewer hours and is less of a financial strain.

Over the past five years, revenue has declined at a CAGR of 1.5% to $1.7 billion, including an expected 1.7% increase in 2024. Industry profit is expected to slump to 10.4% of revenue in 2024 from 14.0% in 2019. However, following the recovery from the pandemic, the industry has experienced growing demand in the latter part of the current period due to improving government funding for universities and total health expenditures.

Over the next five years, industry revenue is expected to rebound, reversing the negative trends experienced during the current period. Government funding for universities is expected to increase, enabling students who need loans or scholarships to better afford massage schools. Also, The number of adults aged 20 to 64 is expected to climb. Most students who train at massage schools are between the ages of 20 and 64, therefore, a climbing adult population typically positively affects industry demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rebounding Demand Will Support Industry Revenue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the economy recovers from the pandemic, the Massage Schools industry is expected to experience a rebound in demand over the five years to 2029, reversing the trend from the previous period. Increasing government funding for universities, an increase in total health expenditure and an increase in the number of adults aged 20 to 64 are all expected to support industry growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry Employment and Wages Are Expected to Rebound Despite a Continued Decline in Establishments
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Although industry revenue is expected to increase, the decline in the number of massage schools is expected to continue, albeit at a slower rate than during the previous period. However, industry employment and wages are expected to reverse previously declining trends and increase slightly over the next five years as schools focus on attracting qualified teachers in an attempt to attract more students.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry provide instruction on massage therapy and issue massage therapy licenses.
key_trends: Massage schools primarily compete with one another based on price and the range of programs offered. To soften the competition, some schools focus on improving their reputation.
Massage schools typically compete on a local basis. This is why the industry is fragmented, though some larger operators compete on a large scale.
Students choose well-reputed schools. Massage schools with an established track record of training enable them to charge more for certificate programs.
Operators require strong recruiting networks. Operators must identify, recruit and enroll students in massage schools in the United States.

The industry has experienced consistent declines over the past five years. Industry establishments have declined every year during the current period as massage schools face challenges in attracting new students.

Rebounding demand will support revenue growth over the next five years. Increasing government funding for universities, an increase in total health expenditure and an increase in the number of adults aged 20 to 64 will support industry growth.
Operators were not able to operate in person due to the pandemic because of lockdown measures.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Students aged between 18 and 30 comprise the largest market and are expected to account for over one-half of industry revenue in 2024. When the number of adults aged 20 to 64 climbs, this market benefits as the adult population grows, which makes it more likely for individuals in this age demographic to attend massage school. The pandemic also supported growth in this market as many American workers reevaluated their careers to pursue something they enjoy rather than following a traditional career path.

Students aged between 31 and 45 comprise the second-largest market and are expected to account for roughly one-third of industry revenue. This market typically experiences growth when the number of adults aged 20 to 64 climbs as more adults in this age demographic are likely to attend massage schools. Similar to students aged between 18 and 30, the pandemic supported growth in this market as many American workers reevaluated their careers to pursue something they enjoy rather than a traditional career path.

Students aged 46 and older comprise the smallest market in the industry. This market has declined due to the growth in the younger demographic markets. In addition, individuals aged 46 and older typically have established career paths and are less likely to attend massage schools compared to younger individuals.

products_and_services.product_description: Certificates comprise the largest product segment and are expected to account for over one-half of industry revenue in 2024. Certificates from massage schools are popular because they typically require less time to attain compared to degrees. A certificate program typically requires between a few months and a couple of years to receive a certification from massage schools. Certificate programs teach students the skills and knowledge needed to become licensed and certified.

Degrees comprise the second-largest product segment and are expected to account for just under one-quarter of industry revenue in 2024. Degree programs typically require more time to complete than certificate programs. However, degree programs generally offer a broader range of education surrounding massage programs and techniques.

tier_2_suppliers: Heating & Air Conditioning Equipment Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: A decline in the unemployment rate tends to hurt demand for industry education as vocational training and certifications become less essential to finding employment. As a result, the industry tends to benefit from a rising unemployment rate. In 2024, the unemployment rate is expected to increase.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest concentration of massage school establishments at 30.2%, higher than its share of the population at 21.8%.
The West region has 22.5% of massage school establishments, slightly lower than its 23.5% share of the population.
The Mid-Atlantic region accounts for 14.3% of massage school establishments, slightly lower than its 15.2% population share.
The Great Lakes region has 11.2% of establishments, lower than its 15.0% share of the population.
The Southwest accounts for 8.5% of establishments, lower than its 11.5% population share.
The Plains region has a higher 6.2% share of establishments compared to its 4.8% population share.
The Rocky Mountains region accounts for 4.5% of establishments, higher than its 3.6% population share.
New England has the lowest share of establishments at 2.6%, lower than its 4.6% population share.

basis_points.basis_title: Massage schools primarily compete with one another based on price and the range of programs offered.
basis_points.basis_description: To soften the competition, some schools focus on improving their reputation.

basis_points.basis_title: Massage schools typically compete on a local basis.
basis_points.basis_description: This is why the industry is fragmented, though some larger operators compete on a large scale.
Massage schools with an established track record of training enable them to charge more for certificate programs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit Shrinks as Wage Expenses Remain High and Purchase Costs Climb
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, will account for an estimated 10.4% of revenue in 2024, down from 14.0% in 2019. Profit can vary depending on the size of operators and the educational programs and services offered. In particular, tuition fees vary depending on what level of program a student is completing. Over the past five years, industry revenue has declined, wage expenses have remained high and purchase costs have climbed, putting downward pressure on industry profit.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages are Steady but Remain High as the Majority of Teaching Happens on a Face-to-Face Basis
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are the most significant industry expense and are expected to account for 35.0% of revenue in 2024, remaining relatively steady with 35.0% in 2019. Wages account for the largest share of total industry costs, in line with the Education sector.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Depreciation Costs Have Climbed Over the Past Five Years
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Depreciation costs are expected to account for 3.9% of revenue in 2024, up from 3.8% in 2019. The industry has many depreciable assets in the form of computers, general school equipment and massage-specific equipment.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: ONLINE COURSES HAVE LIMITED REVENUE DECLINES
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Despite the high degree of hands-on experience, many schools offered online courses during the pandemic. However, online classes are not as useful compared to traditional schooling. Online learning has the potential to reduce operational costs. In addition, online learning offers flexibility for students.

volatility_points.volatility_title: GOVERNMENT FUNDING STRONGLY INFLUENCES DEMAND FOR UNIVERSITIES
volatility_points.volatility_description: Government funding represents federal, state and local grants and appropriations for public and nonprofit private degree-granting institutions. Increases in government funding can increase enrollment in massage schools as it increases the affordability for students who need loans or scholarships. However, attendance dropped through the pandemic, translating to a decline in revenue for the industry.

FAQs.answer: The text provides questions related to regulation and industry assistance levels, but does not give specific answers.

FAQs.question: Industry Data
FAQs.answer: The text includes a data table with yearly values from 2005 to 2016 for the following metrics: Revenue ($ million), Enterprises (units), Establishments (units), Employment (units), Wages ($ million), IVA ($ million). It does not provide values for Imports or Exports.
